lesson.title: Lines, Line Segments, Rays
lesson.body:
Lines: A line is a straight one-dimensional geometric object that extends infinitely in both directions.
Line Segment: A line segment is a straight one-dimensional geometric object that has fixed starting and ending points.
Ray: A ray is a straight one-dimensional geometric object that has a fixed starting point, but extends infinitely.

question.responses: A line, A ray, A line segment

lesson.title: Points, Lines, Planes
lesson.body:
Point: A point is a geometric object that signifies a location, but has no size in itself. Lines, line segments, rays are all collections of points.
Plane: A plane is a flat, two-dimensional surface that extends infinitely far. It is the two-dimensional analogue of a point (zero dimensions), a line (one dimension).
Collinear Points: Points are collinear if they lie on the same line.
Coplanar Points: Points are coplanar if they both lie on the same plane.

lesson.title: Types of Quadrilaterals
lesson.body:
Quad" means "four" and "lateral" means "line." A quadrilateral is literally a shape with four sides (lines) and four angles that add to 360 degrees.
Concave Quadrilaterals: Has one interior angle larger than 180 degrees.
Convex Quadrilaterals: All angles are less than 180 degrees.
Trapezoid: A quadrilateral with exactly 2 sides parallel to each other.
Parallelogram: A quadrilateral with 2 pairs of parallel sides.
Rectangle: A parallelogram with 4 right angles.
Rhombus: A parallelogram where all 4 sides are equivalent.
Square: A rectangular rhombus. In other words, a parallelogramwith 4 right angles are 4 equivalent sides.

lesson.title: Quadrilateral Proofs and Angles
lesson.body:
Adjacent angles of a parallelogram are supplementary: Their sum equals 180.
Opposite angles of a parallelogram are equivalent.
The angles of bases of an isosceles triangle are equal.
Area of a parallelogram is base x the bisecting height: A = bh.

lesson.title: Circle Basics
lesson.body:
Pi : Pi is a fundamental constant when determining many basic properties of circles. It represents the ratio of a circles circumference to its diameter.
Radius : The radius of a circle is the distance between the center of the circle to the edge of the circle.
Diameter : The diameter of a circle is the length of the line segment that divides the circle in half into two semi-circles.
Circumference : The circumference of a circle is the linear distance around its edge. The circumference is essentially the perimeter of the circle.

lesson.title: Standard Equation of a Circle
lesson.body:
General format of circle equation: ax^2 + by^2 + cx + dy + e = 0
Center-radius form of circle: (x - h)^2 + (y - k)^2 = r^2
The center of the circle is easily found using this equation : (h,k)
The radius of the circle is also easily found : (r).

lesson.title: Arcs
lesson.body:
An arc is simply a closed segment of the edge of a circle.
Minor arc : an arc with an angle less than 180 degrees.
Major arc: an arc with an angle greater than 180 degrees.
Arc Measure: arc measure is the angle of the central angle of an arc. In other words, the angle formed between the two radii that connect to the ends of the arc represents the arc measure.
Length of an arc: The equation to find the length of an arc is equal to (theta)r, where (theta) is the angle the arc subtends and r is the radius of the circle.
